description:
A '''guitar solo''' is a [[melody|melodic]] passage, instrumental [[section (music)|section]], or entire piece of music, pre-written (or improvised) to be played on a [[classical guitar|classical]], [[electric guitar|electric]], or [[acoustic guitar]]. In 20th and 21st century [[traditional music]] and [[popular music]] such as [[blues]], [[Swing music|swing]], [[jazz]], [[jazz fusion]], [[rock music|rock]] and [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]], guitar [[solo (music)|solos]] often contain virtuoso techniques and varying degrees of [[improvisation]]. Guitar solos on [[classical guitar]], which are typically written in [[musical notation]], are also used in [[classical music]] forms such as [[chamber music]] and [[concerto]]s.

Guitar solos range from unaccompanied works for a single guitar to compositions with [[accompaniment]] from a few other instruments or a large ensemble. The accompaniment musicians for a guitar solo can range from a small ensemble such as a [[jazz quartet]] or a rock [[musical ensemble|band]], to a large ensemble such as an [[orchestra]] or [[big band]]. Unaccompanied acoustic guitar music is found in [[folk music|folk]] and [[European classical music|classical]] music dating as far back as the [[Musical instrument|instrument's]] first use in western music, the use of an acoustic guitar as a solo voice within an ensemble dates back at least to the [[Baroque]] [[concerto]].
